examples: Replace the product in Figure 1 with that in Figure 2. For the title copy the text in Figure 3 to the top of the screen, the title should have a clear contrast with the background but not be overly eye-catching.
prompt.title: Prompt
prompt.description: The text prompt used to edit the image

num_images.description: Number of separate model generations to be run with the prompt.
num_images.title: Num Images

image_size.title: Image Size
image_size.description: The size of the generated image. Width and height must be between 1920 and 4096, or total number of pixels must be between 2560*1440 and 4096*4096.

max_images.description: If set to a number greater than one, enables multi-image generation. The model will potentially return up to `max_images` images every generation, and in total, `num_images` generations will be carried out. In total, the number of images generated will be between `num_images` and `max_images*num_images`. The total number of images (image inputs + image outputs) must not exceed 15
max_images.title: Max Images

sync_mode.description: If `True`, the media will be returned as a data URI and the output data won't be available in the request history.
sync_mode.title: Sync Mode

enable_safety_checker.title: Enable Safety Checker
enable_safety_checker.description: If set to true, the safety checker will be enabled.

seed.description: Random seed to control the stochasticity of image generation.
seed.title: Seed

image_urls.title: Image URLs
image_urls.description: List of URLs of input images for editing. Presently, up to 10 image inputs are allowed. If over 10 images are sent, only the last 10 will be used.

height.description: The height of the generated image.
height.title: Height

width.description: The width of the generated image.
width.title: Width

height.title: Height
height.description: The height of the image in pixels.

file_size.title: File Size
file_size.description: The size of the file in bytes.

url.description: The URL where the file can be downloaded from.
url.title: Url

width.title: Width
width.description: The width of the image in pixels.

file_name.title: File Name
file_name.description: The name of the file. It will be auto-generated if not provided.

content_type.title: Content Type
content_type.description: The mime type of the file.
